article:
{{Infobox Anatomy | Name = Omental tuber | Latin = Tuber omentale pancreatis,
tuber omentale corporis pancreatis | GraySubject = 251 | GrayPage = 1201 |
Image = illu_pancreas_duodenum.jpg | Caption = 1: Head of pancreas 2:
Uncinate process of pancreas 3: Pancreatic notch 4: Body of pancreas 5:
Anterior surface of pancreas 6: Inferior surface of pancreas 7: Superior
margin of pancreas 8: Anterior margin of pancreas 9: Inferior margin of
pancreas 10: Omental tuber 11: Tail of pancreas 12: Duodenum | Image2 =
| Caption2 = | System = | MeshName = | MeshNumber = | DorlandsPre = t_21 |
DorlandsSuf = 12827549 | }} Where the anterior surface of the pancreas joins the
neck there is a well-marked prominence, the 'tuber omentale', which abuts
against the posterior surface of the lesser omentum.
